meanings.definition: The state or quality of being notable.
meanings.sent1: Her notability in the community made her a well-known figure.
meanings.sent2: The notability of the historical landmark attracted many tourists.
meanings.sent3: The cat's notability in catching mice was quite impressive.
meanings.sent4: The notability of the mountain peak could be seen from miles away.
meanings.sent5: The notability of the singer's voice left the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: The degree to which something is notable or worthy of attention.
meanings.sent1: The notability of the painting was evident from the crowd it drew.
meanings.sent2: The notability of the discovery led to widespread recognition.
meanings.sent3: The notability of the dog's tricks entertained everyone at the park.
meanings.sent4: The notability of the idea shone brightly in the brainstorming session.
meanings.sent5: The notability of the book's plot kept readers engaged till the end.
